title: Export and import integrations
content:
As a best practice, create, configure, and test integrations in the development tenant before you deploy them in the production tenant. You can use the Integration Studio's import/export functionality to migrate integration configuration from the development tenant to the production tenant. First export integrations configured in a tenant to a package (.pkg) file, and then import the export file to another tenant. 

Export integrations

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click in the left pane, and then click Export.
  3. In the Export configuration dialog, select the integrations and scenarios you want to export.
  4. Click OK. The export file (.pkb file) that contains the selected integrations and scenarios is automatically downloaded to your browser's download folder.
  • For the export file to be imported to another system, its size must be less than the Max Dev2Prod package file size configured on the tenant's Application settings form in Suite Administration.
  • You can't export locked integrations and scenarios and the Microsoft Teams integration.

Import integrations

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click  in the left pane, and then click Import.
  3. In the Import dialog, click Select, select the export file, and then click Open.
  4. Click Upload.
  5. Wait until the import Status changes to one of the final statuses (Success, Completed with errors, Failed), and then click OK. If succeeded or completed with errors, review the summary of the import in the Detail grid. For failed items, click the hyperlinked number in the Failed column to view the error message.

Starting from version 26.1, you can import integration packages that were exported from version 25.2 and later.

  • You can't migrate endpoint configuration by using this functionality. In the production system, you can create an endpoint with the same name as the one in the development system so that the migration will automatically associate the integration with the endpoint. Otherwise, you need to manually specify the endpoint in each integration.
  • The import process won't migrate the integrations' Current system integration user value. You need to manually configure this value in the production system.
  • The import process won't migrate the schedule records. You need to manually configure schedules in the production system.
  • If you import the same integration one more time, you need to deactivate it before the import; otherwise, the import will fail. Note that you need to activate the integration and select the endpoint for the integration before you can use it.
  • You can't export integrations that don't have any scenarios configured.
  • You can't export and import the OOTB integrations.
  • For the import to be successful, the development tenant and the production tenant must be on the same version of Service Management.
  • When you migrate a listener-based scenario, listener-related fields that include sensitive data, such as Webhook URL and API Token, aren't imported to the target system. Additionally, the imported scenarios are disabled by default. You need to generate the Webhook URL and API Token, and then enable the scenario.
